title: School of Abjuration

feature_defs.trigger: when you add an abjuration spell to your spellbook
effects: the gold and time you must spend to copy the spell are halved

feature_defs.trigger: when you cast an abjuration spell using a spell slot
effects: create an Arcane Ward that lasts until you finish a long rest
ward has hit points equal to twice your wizard level + your Intelligence modifier
when you take damage, the ward takes the damage instead (after applying resistance and vulnerability), and any remaining damage carries over to you
limits: if the ward is reduced to 0 hit points, it is destroyed
you can’t create the ward again until you finish a long rest
notes: the ward regains hit points when you cast abjuration spells with a spell slot
you can also restore the ward as a bonus action by expending a spell slot (restores ward hp equal to twice the slot level)

feature_defs.trigger: when a creature you can see within 30 ft takes damage
effects: cause your Arcane Ward to absorb that damage instead
limits: damage is deducted from the ward’s hit points and can’t be reduced below 0

effects: Counterspell and Dispel Magic are always prepared for you
when you cast Dispel Magic, you can cast it as a bonus action
when you make an ability check as part of Counterspell or Dispel Magic, you add your proficiency bonus
if you fail to Counterspell a spell, the spell slot you spent is not expended
you have advantage on saving throws against spells
you have resistance to damage from spells

notes: Arcane Ward is persistent state that resets on long rest and can’t be recreated until long rest.
Ward recharge via abjuration-with-slot and via bonus action expending a slot is recorded in notes for rules-engine handling.
